p: Fruits of T. ammi (100 g) yielded 3.5 mL of yellow colored essential oil with a gravity of 0.97 mg/mL. As it was indicated in our previous study, 13 monotrepenes composed 99.1% of the oil, as identified using the gas-chromatography-mass spectrometry (GC-MS) method. Thymol (74.2%), p-cymene (16%), and γ-terpinene (7.1%) were the main constituents of the oil [ 11]. Therefore, the amount of thymol as a major component was assayed in the oil using the GC method. According to the thymol calibration curve, the amount of thymol was 130.7 ± 7.6 µg/mL in the essential oil of T. ammi fruit.
